# Docs

> Agno is a company that provides a powerful agent-based operating system (Agent OS) for building intelligent, autonomous software agents. Their platform enables developers to create custom agents that can automate tasks, manage workflows, and integrate with various systems and services. Agno's Agent OS offers a range of features, including chat interfaces, knowledge management, session tracking, and secure integrations, making it a versatile solution for enterprises and organizations looking to enhance their digital capabilities.

## Getting Started
- [Introduction to Agent OS](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/introduction): An overview of the Agno Agent OS platform, its key features, and how it can be used to build intelligent software agents.
- [Creating Your First Agent OS](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/creating-your-first-os): A guide on how to set up and configure a new Agent OS instance, including customizing its attributes and lifespan.
- [Connecting Your Agent OS](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/connecting-your-os): Instructions on how to connect your Agent OS to various systems, services, and interfaces, such as Slack, WhatsApp, and A2A.

## Customization and Extensibility
- [Customizing Agent OS Configuration](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/customize/config): Documentation on how to customize the configuration of your Agent OS, including setting up custom middleware and overriding routes.
- [Customizing Agent OS with FastAPI](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/customize/custom-fastapi): Guide on how to extend the functionality of your Agent OS by integrating custom FastAPI applications.
- [Middleware in Agent OS](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/customize/middleware/overview): Overview of the middleware system in Agent OS, including how to create custom middleware and integrate JWT authentication.

## Agent OS Features
- [Chat Interface in Agent OS](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/features/chat-interface): Information on the built-in chat interface feature of Agent OS, which allows agents to communicate with users.
- [Knowledge Management in Agent OS](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/features/knowledge-management): Details on the knowledge management capabilities of Agent OS, which enable agents to access and utilize relevant information.
- [Memories in Agent OS](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/features/memories): Documentation on the memory management system in Agent OS, which allows agents to store and retrieve relevant data.
- [Session Tracking in Agent OS](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/features/session-tracking): Information on the session tracking feature of Agent OS, which enables agents to maintain context and state across interactions.

## Interfaces and Integrations
- [A2A Integration in Agent OS](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/interfaces/a2a/introduction): Introduction to the Agent-to-Agent (A2A) integration capabilities of Agent OS, which allow agents to communicate and collaborate with each other.
- [Agent UI Integration in Agent OS](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/interfaces/ag-ui/introduction): Documentation on the Agent UI integration, which provides a web-based interface for interacting with and managing your Agent OS instances.
- [Slack Integration in Agent OS](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/interfaces/slack/introduction): Information on how to integrate your Agent OS with Slack, enabling your agents to communicate and collaborate with users within the Slack platform.
- [WhatsApp Integration in Agent OS](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/interfaces/whatsapp/introduction): Guide on integrating your Agent OS with WhatsApp, allowing your agents to interact with users through the popular messaging app.

## Agent OS Management and Security
- [Agno MCP (Management Control Plane)](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/mcp/mcp): Overview of the Agno Management Control Plane (MCP), which provides centralized management and monitoring capabilities for your Agent OS instances.
- [MCP Tools and Utilities](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/mcp/tools): Information on the various tools and utilities available in the Agno MCP for managing and maintaining your Agent OS deployments.
- [Security in Agent OS](https://docs.agno.com/agent-os/security): Documentation on the security features and best practices for ensuring the safety and integrity of your Agent OS deployments.

## Concepts and Fundamentals
- [Building Agents](https://docs.agno.com/concepts/agents/building-agents): Guidance on the process of building custom agents using the Agno Agent OS platform, including information on dependencies and development best practices.
- [Agent Context](https://docs.agno.com/concepts/agents/context): Overview of the concept of agent context in the Agno platform, and how it is used to maintain state and information across interactions.
- [Custom Logging in Agents](https://docs.agno.com/concepts/agents/custom-logger): Documentation on how to implement custom logging mechanisms for your agents, to aid in debugging and monitoring.
- [Debugging Agents](https://docs.agno.com/concepts/agents/debugging-agents): Guidance on the tools and techniques available for debugging and troubleshooting issues with your custom agents.
- [Agent Dependencies](https://docs.agno.com/concepts/agents/dependencies): Information on managing and handling dependencies for your custom agents, to ensure they function correctly within the Agno platform.
